document.docAuthor: Huang, Jia, Su, Yirui & Chen, Hongwei
document.masterDocTitle: The genus Leucophenga (Diptera, Drosophilidae), part VII: the subpollinosa species group from China, with morphological and molecular evidence

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The genus Leucophenga (Diptera, Drosophilidae), part VII: the subpollinosa species group from China, with morphological and molecular evidence

bibRefCitation.author: Okada
bibRefCitation.refString: Okada, T. (1987) The Leucophenga subpollinosa group of Japan and Southeast Asia (Diptera, Drosophilidae). Kontyu, 55 (4), 676 - 683.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. This species resembles
L . cultella
sp. nov.
in having the wing fuscous along R1 and costa ( Fig. 2 C, I), and the color patterns of abdominal tergites in both male ( Figs. 7 D, 8J) and female ( Fig. 8 K), but can be distinguished from the latter by having the thorax mostly dark colored ( Fig. 3 E, F), the paramere narrowed basally ( Fig. 12 C), and the aedeagus thick, reticulated medially, laterally with a thick process ( Fig. 12 D); see below that species.

However, the specimens show somewhat differences from the description of the holotype from Taiwan , China ( Okada 1987 ) in the color patterns of abdominal tergites in male ( Fig. 7 D), and the structure of aedeagus ( Fig. 12 D), while no conspicuous difference could be found in the patterns of wing ( Fig. 2 C), and the shape of paramere and aedeagus ( Fig. 12 C, D; Fig. 1 F in Okada 1987 ); moreover, parts of the specimens were collected near the type locality. Therefore, all of the specimens were identified as
L . formosa
to avoid further confusion.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 12.
Leucophenga formosa Okada, 1987
, male terminalia in lateral view. A. Epandrium, surstylus and cercus; B. Hypandrium, paramere, gonopods and aedeagus; C. Paramere; D. Aedeagus and laterally process (lp). Scale bars = 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Ocellar triangle dark brown, with ca. 0–2 seta(e) above ocellar setae. Frons yellowish to brownish, with an indistinct, brown, longitudinal stripe medially. Pedicel brownish yellow to brownish; first flagellomere yellow to brownish yellow. Clypeus brownish to brown. Palpus yellow to brownish yellow. Mesonotum mostly with three broad, brown, longitudinal stripes medially and laterally ( Fig. 3 E). Postpronotal lobe yellow to brownish yellow ( Fig. 3 F). Acrostichal setulae in ca. 10–12 irregular rows ( Fig. 3 E). Scutellum dark brown, brown at tip in male ( Fig. 3 E), brownish yellow at tip in female. Pleura, katepisternum and meron mostly brown above ( Fig. 3 F). Wing ( Fig. 2 C): Costal vein between R2+3 and R4+5 distally with ca. 5–6 peg-like spinules on ventral surface. Midleg obviously brown on knees. Abdominal tergites mostly dark brown ( Fig. 7 D), with a pair of yellow patches submedially between 2nd to 3rd tergites in both male and female. Male terminalia: Epandrium with ca. 4 setae near posterior margin per side ( Fig. 12 A). Surstylus rounded apically ( Fig. 12 A). Hypandrium with 1 sensillum ( Fig. 12 B). Paramere with ca. 5 sensilla distodorsally ( Fig. 12 C). Aedeagus thick, acute apically ( Fig. 12 D).

Specimens examined. CHINA : 3♂ ( SCAU , Nos 128906–08), Shennongjia , Hubei ,
